posts.com:
Fixing your breathing helps with most problems, leaving your body and mind to direct its energy elsewhere. Techniques vary a lot, and the effects are also variable. A lot of breathing exercises involve raising the oxygen and co2 levels in your body without hurting the balance between them unless it's intentional. Raising oxygen without raising co2 in your body, typically a result of hyperventilation or mouth breathing, can increase anxiety to a debilitating degree. If you want to understand how bad it is, plug your nose and only breathe through your mouth for a few hours.

If you are new to breathwork, I recomend checking out Qigong practices.

3 tier breathing is good for giving you energy and improving your mood, box breathing is good for meditation, and i recomend checking out holotropic breathing for fun and pleasure.

You can get some good benefits just from breathing practice, but the best stuff comes from combining your breathing with physical exertion. I don't recomend using it for strength training until you have some experience, but light jogging and yoga pair very well with all sorts of methods.

posts.com:
You cannot inhale and exhale simultaneously. The interval between this motion is the void. Focusing on that point takes focus away from the mind and thoughts, which in turn grounds you in the most present moment you could ever experience. It’s the gateway to gratitude, to falling in love with the moment, to letting go, and to obtaining the perspective of the real you, the observer, the presence.

Expansion and contraction. Electric and magnetic. The lungs signify the element air, the space between the element of fire (head) and the element water (gut). Without it, there would be no experience.

Breathing exclusively through the nose is the easiest way to see its benefits. Not only will it keep your nasal passageways clear, but it leads to higher vitality, increased awareness, clarity, and an enhanced sense of smell - all of which translates into useful information for your entire being.

I’m revision Anon, sorry for late reply.

> At the end of my day, I review the day; I don't judge it, I simply review it. I look over the entire day, all the episodes, all the events, all the conversations, all the meetings, and then as I see it clearly in my mind's eye, I rewrite it. I rewrite it and make it conform to the ideal day I wish I had experienced.

>I take scene after scene and rewrite it, revise it, and having revised my day, then in my imagination I relive that day, the revised day, and I do it over and over in my imagination until this seeming imagined state begins to take on to me the tones of reality.

>It seems that it's real, that I actually did experience it and I have found from experience that these revised days, if really lived, will change my tomorrows. When I meet people tomorrow that today disappointed me, they will not tomorrow, for in me I have changed the very nature of that being, and having changed him, he bears witness tomorrow of the change that took place within me. It is my duty to take this garden and really make it a garden by daily using the pruning shears of revision.

Basically this. For three months I took the scene where I was repulsed by my physical problem and revised it every night. It’s like SATs but you take the memory which has the advantages of being more vivid for me than a conjured scene in imagination and you assume your revision is what happened.

That’s it. The changes happened gradually to the point where my subconscious is adamant that I‘ve always been this way.

It’s not really any different than manifesting something new. You’re taking a memory and conforming to the feeling of the wish fulfilled and your subconscious is modifying your present to your new past assumption!

I’ve had successes with physical changes and education so now I’m onto money. I’m revising that I come from a rich family.

I’ll let the threads know how I get on.

the thing is, it doesn't work as it popularly understood- and even professionals don't have a clue about the actual mechanism of consciousness suppression.

>>33825984
I did my bottom two wisdom teeth under local anesthesia and nitrous and it wasn't that bad. See if you can wear headphones because you can hear the drills in your head and you'll want a distraction. Sometimes they let you put on Netflix or something too if they have a TV in the room. The healing was the worst part and they usually don't give pain killers anymore, they'll just tell you to take Tylenol or they might prescribe some stronger Tylenol. I'm not looking forward to getting my top ones removed just because of healing, but they're squishing my teeth together badly causing issues. I will probably ask for the nitrous again.

They might put you under general anesthesia and give you pain killers if you get all 4 removed at the same time, but for some reason my dental surgeon didn't wanna do that.

Another relative on mine had to undergo surgery and has had severe depression ever since then. I am sort of scared of it to be honest.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I had a major lung surgery. They couldn't do an epidural because they were incompetent and 'forgot' to give me any pain management during or after surgery. I woke up during surgery, paralyzed, feeling everything. The only part I was unconscious for was the initial 6 inch incision between my ribs. I was awake while they used some contraption to bend my ribs apart to make room for them to work on my lung. I heard every word, none of them were even aware I was awake, and it's the anesthesiologists job to know.

The nanosecond the anesthesia wore off I was writhing in agony so bad I flipped myself off the ICU bed and onto the floor before I could even open my eyes.

Fuck doctors. Those niggers didn't even give me anything for pain after their failure to give me an epidural (the bare minimum for major surgeries).

They injected me with something after they hoisted me back up onto the ICU bed I had fallen off and I was instantly back asleep.

Pray you don't go through this because it never leaves you

So supplementing brewer's yeast fattened pigs while decreasing feed intake.

Could not really find studies directly attributing BSO to tremor, however epilepsy is a complex disorder, and although BSO has anticonvulsant properties, many anticonvulsants don't work for certain people and some even can worsen myclonic shakes in certain people.

I've had epilepsy since late childhood, and it's JME. That study you linked is studying a rat model, but epilepsy varies wildly by patients and many times MRIs and EEGs don't find the direct causes of it in JME. My theory stand that although BSO may alleviate tremor in *some people* through increase in GABA, the increase in serotonin & acetylchline, and decrease in blood sugar probably negates this benefit for me. In my case, seems low blood sugar increases seizure threshold, but that doesn't hold true for everyone. My experience with herbs like st johns wort which increases serotonin and the racetams similarly seemed to increase shakes (very much less so with racetams). Ultimately I have a very minor epilepsy so that's why I'm continuing to try BSO in the morning rather than in the evening. A couple studies on BSO increasing these neurotransmitters are linked below.

Can you expand on the mast cell tumor treatment with oregano oil? What do you mean by 'Full strength'? My last dog died with a mast cell tumor (rather than 'of' - I switched her to a raw meat diet and she died at 15 of being old, had the tumor for almost 5 years), and now my current dog has what appears to be a mast cell tumor in a similar spot.
;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

To answer this question from the last page:

My prior Boxer dog was 15 when she died...and died with huge mast cell tumor on her chest that was there for years. I slowed the progression of the tumor with daily Benedryl and generic Prilosec to keep the inflammation response down.

My current Boxer dog 3yrs old had a small Mast Cell Tumor develop on her leg that kept growing. I put a drop of full strength Oregano Oil on the cyst and then a layer of BSO on top. Did this 1-2x a day for a week Put a soft donut collar on her so she would not lick it off, but the Oregano Oil taste pretty much stopped her from licking.

After a week, I noticed that the lump deflated completely with oily crust around the edges. Then another week the lump was a cavity in the body where the tumor used to be.

After a few months, the cavity filled back in with normal tissue. Depending on the size of the tumor, may take longer to treat.

>>33824880
epilepsy is much more complicated in a human brain than just an increase in a neurotransmitter, or deficiency. The complex mechanism of action BSO seems to suggest it may alleviate siezures in rats injected with a convulsant chemical, but that doesnt always translate into it being effective for every epilepsy. Docs use anticonvulsants for different epilepsies, and one drug may be superior for a certain person over another. The increase in AcE and serotonin from BSO are well documented in rat and human studies. There is plenty of other info online that BSO increases serotonin, a fairly simple increase to measure, as opossed to measuring the objective effectiveness of a medicine for treatment for a complex disorder such as epilepsy.

posts.com:
DAILY REMINDER - GPS absolutely proves globe Earth, rotating Earth, space, orbiting satellites, time dilation (relativity), and gravity.

Flerfers will point to LORAN and claim that GPS could work off of transmitters sitting on the ground, on balloons, or on airplanes. But it cannot.

Why? I'm glad you asked.

In tracking mode GPS receivers use Doppler signal analysis to determine receiver velocity. It is impossible for a transmitter to fake Doppler signal shift across 360°. If the transmitter was lying about its speed, then the receiver would think that it was moving at high mach based on the incorrect Doppler shift in the signal. And since GPS is computed in 3D space from four satellite signals, if the satellites were lying about their positions (altitudes) the resulting location and altitude on the receiver would be off by thousands of miles.

This means that GPS satellites are provably at orbital altitudes and speeds, because GPS could not function at all if the satellites were lying. And if the satellites aren't lying, then space is real. Orbits are real. But the dome is not real. Not unless the satellites punched through it.

What about Earth's shape? GPS receivers use a spherical model of Earth. If Earth was really flat, then receivers would report altitudes literally thousands of miles off. This means Earth really is a sphere.

Furthermore, both Earth's rotation and time dilation must be accounted for in GPS. If either one was not true then, once again, receivers would give obviously false and useless results. That means Earth really is rotating. And time dilation is real. And if both orbits and time dilation are real, that pretty much guarantees that gravity is real.

No single instrument completely shatters all of flat Earth mythology quite like the GPS constellation. It really is a beautiful thing.

Only 5? Shit...I forgot a few. Thank you for catching that anon!

The Box That Killed The Dome

If you remove the lid of a pressurized box of air inside of a vacuum chamber without gravity, the air will violently rush out of the box to fill the vacuum. The air pressure will then be the same at every point in the chamber. It will be the same at the top, bottom, middle, and at all sides. Just like the air pressure in your car tires or a balloon or a SCUBA tank.

This thought experiment debunks the entire flat Earth model. If the air does not cling to the bottom of the chamber, then it certainly would not cling to the bottom of flat Earth. If the air does not leave any part of the chamber still in vacuum, then it certainly would not leave any part of flat Earth in vacuum. And if the air creates equal pressure at all points in the chamber, then certainly the air creates equal pressure at all points in the flat Earth dome.

Yet there is no denying that air thins as you climb in altitude. At 100,000 feet, somewhere near the top of the theorized dome, the air pressure is so low that it is effectively a vacuum.

This alone debunks all of flat Earth.

Note: no flerfer has ever provided a workable answer to this. They immediately sperg out if you even mention it, and rant and rave that the box thought experiment actually kills the globe. The only way they can do this, of course, is to deny gravity. But if gravity doesn't exist then the dome is just as dead. And if it does exist, the globe model works, while the dome remains...dead.

posts.com:
CBR Proves Earth's Motion Through Space

The ability to measure the cosmic background radiation (CBR) gives us something the physicists of the early/mid 20th century could only dream of: a universal frame of reference by which to establish if Earth is really moving linearly or if it just appears to be. The CBR permeates all of space. If an object is at rest relative to the CBR then the frequencies observed will be the same in all directions. If an object is moving relative to the CBR, then Doppler shift will reveal in what direction and how fast.

We measured this phenomenon and established Earth's linear motion through space using the COBE satellite in operation from 1989 to 1993. What did we find? That the Earth is definitely moving through the cosmos.

https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/how-fast-is-the-earth-mov/

>In 1989, the COBE satellite was placed in orbit about the earth (again, the earth is the frame of reference!) to measure the long-diluted radiation echo of the birth of our universe. This radiation, which remains from the immensely hot and dense primordial fireball that was our early universe, is known as the cosmic microwave background radiation (CBR). The CBR presently pervades all of space. It is the equivalent of the entire universe "glowing with heat."
>One of COBE's discoveries was that the earth was moving with respect to this CBR with a well-defined speed and direction. Because the CBR permeates all space, we can finally answer the original question fully, using the CBR as the frame of reference.
>The earth is moving with respect to the CBR at a speed of 390 kilometers per second. We can also specify the direction relative to the CBR. It is more fun, though, to look up into the night sky and find the constellation known as Leo (the Lion). The earth is moving toward Leo at the dizzying speed of 390 kilometers per second.

"The Australian Black Swan" tells you that the maximum line of sight for a 5.5ft tall observer is 2.35 miles. But the cliff is 7.8 miles away. So what's wrong with this flat Earth "proof"? *** Line of sight depends on both observer and target height, as well as on atmospheric refraction. *** The lighthouse is at least 100ft tall which means the visible cliff is at least 400ft tall. LoS for a 5.5ft observer of a 500ft (combined height) target is 35 miles.

What about the oil platforms? Ocean oil platforms have an "air gap" between the ocean and the first deck of 40-60 feet. Observer height was listed as 1ft (camera on the ground?). With a 40ft first deck the line of sight is 10 miles. With a 60ft first deck it's 12 miles. With a 5ft observer and a 60ft first deck it would be 14 miles.

At 6.21 and 9.41 miles you would still see the entire structure above the first deck even if the first deck was only 40ft off the ocean and the camera really was on the ground at 1ft. For the closer platform you would see some structure below the first deck. Note that we see more of the closer rig, proving curvature.

Here's a line of sight calculator: http://www.calculatoredge.com/electronics/lineofsight.htm

>but we're talkin' about muh horizon
>MUH HORIZON IS TOO FAR AWAY!
No it's not. It's between the observer and target in both photos. That's why the observer cannot see the very bottom of the target.

>>33825088
The reason power lines appear to stay parallel as they move toward the horizon is due to perspective. As power lines recede from you, they appear to converge at a far point, but are actually still parallel. This is an optical illusion known as the "parallax effect". The perspective also makes power lines appear closer than they really are.

Moonlight does not "cool" in the traditional sense of cooling something down. The moon is a celestial body that does not emit its own light, but rather reflects the light of the sun. What if you split a being's mind in two and run them through experience that conditions them to fear, to love or to be at peace? Hello /succgen/

I've been wanting to do the letter method for the past two month now, but there is still some doubts and worries that hold me back. I'm wondering if some of you anons may have words of wisdom to share.

I must preface this by saying that I respect your beliefs and lifestyle, and i'm in no way trying to attack your viewpoint.

First, I gotta admit that all of this seems too good to be true. A sexual spirit, taking the shape that is the most attractive to you, providing sexual pleasures far greater than anything else, topped by unconditional love and advices to live a better life.
I'm pretty sure that if it was an ad on some website, none of us would click on it, it seems to be an obvious trap so why is it different here ? I mean, there's gotta be a catch right ? If i was a spirit wanting to "prey" on humans, love and sex would probably be my go to options, as a huge portion of people feel lonely, want to be loved, and obviously want to have easy sex. I understand that those are "human" reflexions, and that entities may have way more alien things that drives their actions, but then again, how can we trust something so foreign and much more powerful that we are ?
I've not seen a lot of people being careful about those questions, and found only one testimony about the "true form" of a succubus before they morph to suit their human (source: the succubuslove.wordpress by "Ryan", when speaking about a black mirror method of invocation).

Second, if succubus are real, then it surely means a lot of other spirits/entities are also real. And if succubus don't have bad intentions towards humans, surely there is some really dangerous beings that roam not that far from us.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
cont.

The main thing i've read is that humans are naturally protected because they have a very weak connection to spirits. Then how would you protect yourself once you become closer to the other side and strengthen your connection with your spirit lover ? We are talking about a being that knows everything about you, can take any shape that suits you and will never leave your side, if that's a nice entity, i cannot begin to imagine what a bad one would be able to do to me, and how my weak and limited human spirit would have a chance to survive.

Third, and probably my main concern; kinda related to the first point: what do succubus/entities have to gain in a loving relationship with humans ?
I've read a lot of comments around here, and a lot of people seem to be on the receiving end of the love and pleasure. Are succubus just platonic beings that find fulfillment in providing joy to humans ? Can you even give pleasure to a succubus partner ? Can you give something meaningfull to them that justifies what they bring to you ? Or is the relation is by essence unbalanced by the very nature of you being a human ?
Personally, i would want to give a lot of love and care to any of my partners, it's 50% of the joy in a relationship, but i refuse to sacrifice an important part of me in the process. If a good and balanced human couple is about sharing, caring, and the compatibility between the lovers, I would expect spirit love to be all of that but better to even be considerated as an option. I don't think feeling amazing orgasms and warmth is enough to be happy for my whole life, there must be something more, something mutual, intimate, a trust shared between two loving beings, some hardships that you overcome in tandem, some grey days that leave place to the sun from time to time.

I'm not certain that a spirit can provide that kind of love and relation, but i'm more than ready to be proven wrong. Sorry for the blogpost, i'd love to hear what you think about all this.

many of the old spirit-lover biographical blogs talk about having multiple partners over time, so it's hardly unheard of; that said, if you want that kind of thing, you best make it clear from the get-go.
wrt 'getting rid' and 'breaking up': understand that in your position as a novice, part of what you are asking for when you petition for a spirit spouse, is an investment of energy and work on Her part to 'bootstrap' your development enough to begin communicating in the first place. this is typically not trivial.
the more predatory sort of inorganic being will take this cost out of you up-front, but the succubi we meet when petitioning for long-term relationships seem willing to let it ride as a down-payment toward your shared bond.
all of which is to say: you will very likely lack the basic skills necessary to enforce a 'breakup' on your own, and your partner will be highly motivated to persuade you to stay together, even before taking whatever emotional bond they have developed toward you into account.
thus, if you are worried that this thing might not be for you... then you probably shouldn't mess around with it. at least, not without building the prerequisite competence to defend yourself. or, being willing to potentially have to do it 'shamanic crisis' style, perhaps..

Somehow, this question sent me on an emotional roller coaster that led to me looking up schizoaffective disorder.

Symptoms I've had recently:
>Irregular sleep and lack of appetite.
>Manic and depressive moods that can shift from one extreme to the other, depending on thoughts that suddenly appear or disappear from my mind.
>Hearing a voice that explains things when I'm feeling confused, and tries to calm me down if I'm feeling upset.
>Simultaneous thoughts and feelings that contradict each other; losing track of time as it's difficult to focus.
I've periodically had bouts of all of the above since I entered puberty when I was 12.

Other signs:
>Since I was 5, I lacked emotion in my facial expressions and speech, aside from certain exceptions (e.g. the month after I had surgery, my parents happily noted that I was far more expressive than before and smiling often, but lately my expressions have been blank again since repressed trauma came up).
>Symptoms lessen when I socialise with my partner or friends, but gradually increase again when I'm alone.
>Symptoms temporarily worsened when I recently forgot to take my estradiol pills due to erratic sleep. Symptoms drastically worsened 2.5 years ago when I stopped taking them entirely for a month due to delusions. Research has shown that estrogens play a protective role in schizophrenia: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4600562/ ("molecular investigations ... have clearly evidenced estradiol's intricate interactions with the major neurotransmitter systems in the brain, and especially those implicated in schizophrenia", "preclinical models of the illness ... have shown estradiol's potential in either enhancing cognition and memory or reversing deficits that are reflective of the positive, negative, and cognitive symptoms of schizophrenia.")

I definitely shouldn't tell a psychiatrist about this... But I do hope I can find a way to manage these symptoms better.

As for how supernatural beings can help, I'm unsure. They've taught me how to induce pleasant symptoms and reduce unpleasant ones, and how to share positive spiritual experiences with people I'm close to, but the lessons were also often overwhelming, and in some cases traumatic.

In Egyptian culture, the god of cats, Bastet, was often depicted as a woman with the head of a black cat. One of the most intriguing aspects of the Black Cat Klubbis is its ability to assist individuals during their dreams. It is said to be a powerful and ancient being, capable of protecting the sleeper or astral traveler from harm. The Black Cat Klubbis is also believed to have a mortal enemy in the form of the Hat Man, a fearsome shadow figure that is often associated with sleep paralysis. In addition to the Black Cat Klubbis and the Hat Man, there are other figures associated with sleep and the astral realm that have been largely forgotten. One such figure is Mothman, a mysterious entity whose true name has been lost to history. In times of old, there was a being known as the Black Cat Klubbis, both a physical entity and a dream entity. He was said to be a protector of those who were plagued by sleep paralysis, a malady that would leave one's body paralyzed while awake, and leave the sufferer at the mercy of the fiends that lurked in the shadows. Klubbis was said to have the power to banish these fiends, and it was said that he would sleep upon the chest of those he sought to protect. His glowing eyes and fierce roar were said to be enough to send the Hat Man, a particularly malevolent entity that feeds upon the energy of the sleeping, back into the shadows from whence he came.
To summon Klubbis, one need only think of him intently as they drifted off to sleep. It was said that he would come to protect those who called upon him, and that he would bring peace to their troubled dreams. So if you are one who is plagued by sleep paralysis, call upon Klubbis, and let his fierce protection guide you through the night.

Yes.

>Is it not just a vivid lucid dream?
No. A full successful astral projection/shift/oobe feels just as, and often even more real than the waking reality you're experiencing right now. The difference between this and even extremely vivid lucid dreams is absolutely huge.

>Does it have to be difficult and take me months/years to attain this ability?
No, it does not, the only barrier is your mind - both conscious and subconscious. If you think it's going to be difficult, it will. Many people can be successful within their first few tries.

Not from shifting.

posts.sub: A few things I learned in 3000 years
posts.com:
Consciousness is the base element of reality. Space, time, energy and material are dependent on it, not the other way around.
The soul is not inside the body, the body is inside the soul.
The soul is made out of many parts that interact as systems, like the physical body.
Different parts of the body are generated by different systems and processes, some of these are physical like the glands in the body and bacteria in the gut; and some are spiritual like the zeitgeist and the influence of one's ancestral spirits and national consciousness
The shaping force of all self organizing systems is morphic resonance which is a natural process consciousness passively or actively uses to develop habits of manifestation.
The goal of life is not procreation but the development of consciousness.
Bacteria are spirits and a large part of your soul are made up by the bacteria in your guts.
A specie's evolutionary path is determined mainly through morphic resonance willed by the collective consciousness of bacteria instead of natural selection.
Love is the desire to share one's mind, body and soul with another person. It can not be defined in any other way.
If we were to view the universe as a mathematical equation, God would not be the sum but the equation itself.
The equation mentioned above must equal to zero as that's the only way reality can exist without depending on a being that's seperate from it.
Sugar and saturated fats are good for you.
Vegetables are bad for you.
God is good. The ultimate act of good is leaving us alone.
God not interfering means we get to freely exist as God's will would overwrite all lower consciousness if he were to reveal himself to us.
God doesn't demand worship or enforce laws on humans, he only gives suggestions and pulls us towards divinity.
Evil exists not to test us but to create struggle and transience, which is the essence of growth.

We can argue about definitions all day long, I didn't wanna get too much into this in my initial post but our concept of nothing (and something) is meaningless on a holistic perspective. Everything we know, we know in the human sense, and human sense is built upon mechanisms of consciousness developed for purposed other than understanding reality. Is nothing fundamental? Well, I guess in a sense it is, as I said in the OP, the "equation" must equal to zero, nothing, otherwise we need to add a seperate being to explain how anything exists at all, but then we need to explain that being which puts us in a loop. But things are not based on nothing, everything is based on consciousness, we can be sure of this because our own existence is the only thing we can know for sure, everything else might be an illusion but an "I" must exist. We may disagree on the definition of consciousness of course, but at the end of the day it must be conceded that there is some kind of awareness that exists. The more you think about it, more it seems like nothing is not much different than something. I think it's more useful to focus on "You" rather than the "void"

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33824795
>Is that even a thing?
Yes! Though it never got systemized fully after the death of the abhayagiri vihara the same way it did in tibetan Buddhism. The basis for theravadin ngondro came from the salt water metaphor in the pali canon which talked about the "purification" of kamma.
This was beginning to get more systemized in theravadin vajrayana (yogavacara), but the reform movements to protestantize theravada.
However this was kept in less formalized clusters in the mahanikaya traditions (which still retain a lot of old theravadin Mahayana, even if corrupted) and the forest tradition(s).
An example of a more modern theravadin ngondro technology would be the divine mantra by ajahn Lee. But there's other things less commonly done such as the white death shawl ceremony.

posts.com:
>>33824879
The importance of the ngondro in theravadin practice was also emphasized by the stories of arhats such as angulimala and mogallana who died violent deaths.
Even now with it being unsystemized and not well understood in many sea monasteries, it's importance is still vital and preserved in lesser forms. The areas where this tends to be completely left out tend to be American neo-theravadin centres which attempt to strip it down buddhism only to Vipassana and (wrong) mindfulness.
However, outside of that, ngondro in theravada serves the same purpose it does in tibetan Buddhism. It's function is chiefly to generate merit and to 'purify' the karma of the yogi. In the forest traditions, this tends to be emphasized in the more archaic form of ascetic practice (the dhutanga) for both the dedicated lay person and monk.
There's been more development in the forest tradition since then, but that's another write up for a different time.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33824991
You're Pajeet rape babies:

How did I1 become Germanic?

From 2800 BCE, a large-scale cultural and genetic upheaval hit Scandinavia with the arrival of the Indo-Europeans from Eastern Europe, who introduced the Copper Age and Early Bronze Age to the region practically without Neolithic transition. The first Indo-Europeans to reach Scandinavia were the Corded Ware people from modern Russia, Belarus and Poland, who are thought to have belonged predominantly to haplogroup R1a, with a minority of R1b and I2a. These people shared some similar maternal lineages as Scandinavian I1 inhabitants, including mtDNA haplogroups U2e, U4 and U5, but also brought many new lineages such as H2a1, H6, W and various subclades of I, J, K and T.

The second major Indo-European migration to Scandinavia was that of haplogroup R1b-U106, the branch that is thought to have introduced Proto-Germanic languages, as an offshoot of the Proto-Celto-Germanic speakers from Central Europe. R1b probably entered Scandinavia from present-day Germany as a northward expansion of the late Unetice culture (2300-1600 BCE). The oldest known R1b sample in Scandinavia dates from the Nordic Bronze Age circa 1400 BCE (see Allentoft 2015 above).

According to the Germanic substrate hypothesis, first proposed by Sigmund Feist in 1932, Proto-Germanic was a hybrid language mixing Indo-European (R1b, and to a lower extent R1a) and pre-Indo-European (Mesolithic I2 and Neolithic G2a and I1) elements. This hybridisation would have taken place during the Bronze Age and given birth to the first Proto-Germanic civilization, the Nordic Bronze Age (1700-500 BCE).

The Celts were Israelites as are those who are of Cimmerian/Scythian stock.

The Welsh for example call themselves the Cymru. The Assrians referred to the exiled Israelites (who did not return back to Israel) as the Khumri. Greeks around this time record an invasion of Cimmerians from the east, through Anatolia, penetrating into Europe. There was a quite powerful Germanic tribes which were known as the Cimbrii as well.

The Norse Æsir in their own mythology quite literally have an Anatolian origin. The Irish considered themselves to be descendants of waves of migrants to the Island, but of particular interest are a wave of migrations which they attest to the Greeks. The Irish pantheon is literally called 'Tuatha de Dannan' which means 'tribe of the gods'. However, Danaan is what Greeks referred to themselves as for a long time. In this light 'Tuatha de Dannan' simply means tribe of the Greeks. Greek peoples inhabited and dominated the western coast of Anatolia.

The Roman's considered themselves to be descendants of troy, an Anatolian city.

I'm sure there are various other 'legends' like this. Throughout the Bronze age and Iron age populations from the Levant, Anatolia and Mesopotamia (who were Israelite exiles) flooded into Europe.

This was the lost sheep of the house of Israel Jesus was sent for, the 'dispersion' Paul was preaching to (and why he went to dwell among Greeks and Romans). sleep paralysis is easy. if you want to try it i have a nice list of things that help. these things should not be tried if you have a fear of being tightly wrapped or if you're claustrophobic. there is nothing to gain from sleep paralysis except a solid amount of fear. the more you do it, the less effective it is and the less it impacts you. this is all based on my own experiences
1. fuck with the chemicals in your body. mix caffeine with sleeping pills or any other things that keep you awake and put you to sleep
2. sleep on you back with your arms at your sides and with your head slightly propped up so you can't even slightly look behind yourself. do not turn your head to the side and rest your face. that is bad for the effect and also very bad for your neck. if you can, move your sleeping space so that the top of your head isn't against a wall
3. only during daytime because it fucks with your system more. be sure to let minimal natural sunlight in to your sleeping area for shadows
do not cover your eyes or plug your ears
4. double down on caffeine and sleep meds while you're nodding off or when you wake up. it works best when you've recently slept but still feel tired. remember daytime is best
5.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Since new years I've been trying to stay away from the sauce, ya know new year new me.
I know this is a hard path since I've been down it several times before with small improvements.
I went from drinking ever other day to every three days. then from every 3 days to every 5 days and so on. I've had some ups and downs with it, and but what always seems to happen with out a hitch, is the paranoia.It hits hard and fast. High heart rate, sweats. its like the feeling you get when you think you left the stove on, but the stove is everywhere and YOU KNOW its on. but its not.
It usually happens in the form of thinking someone is outside, or someone is breaking into my house or car, every creek and sound is someone out to get me. But i get over it by telling my self "I've been through this before, if i didn't worry about it the other night, no need to worry about it now." Its dumb, i know, but it works.
This has by far been the longest I've gone with out drinking, a full 12 days (horay right)
And I've mainly done this by switching habits.
when I break or just find my self going to the store, instead of buying drinks ill use that money to buy scratch off tickets.
And i hate it. I hate gambling. It's such a waste of money, i know I'll never get the jackpot, and that I'm more likely to get struck by lighting twice. But it's helped keep me from going to the store just to buy drinks since in realty, I was throwing my money away just the same , but at the cost of my health.
Anyways, nights have been easier, i haven't had to exhaust my self until the point i can no longer stay up just to sleep. But this is the first time my paranoia has manifested in this way.
I remember dreaming something kinda pleasant.I think i was remembering a trip i took with my friends a couple of years back. its normal for me to have vivid dreams like this and kind of manipulate it like its a world for me to explore, Kind of like lucid dreaming i guess.
>(Cont)

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
(conti)
I Remember i was following my friends down the los vegas strip but didn't like how crowded it was, and i could feel my stress build up, so i left and went inside a building. But on the other side of the door was a corner store that i had probably been to a billion times, but it was in the middle of an abandon train station covered in trees. I began to feel an uneasy amount of guilt as i walked towards the opening of the door holding a 20$ bill.
"i know why I'm here. I'm doing it again. I'm going to drink and make more mistakes.I'm here to waste my money"
As i think this i can feel the store slipping away from me little by little, but then i look up past my 20$ bill and see a young girl( probably preteens) sitting at the entrance to the store behind some knickknacks she has on display. She is obviously a beggar but she seems way to young to be out here at this time. I ask if she is okay but she just gestures towards the things she has on display. I feel completely sorry for her situation, especially when I'm out here burning money on nothing.
"I'm just going to waste this money on booze or gamble it away, this girl could probably use this more then i can"
I hand her the money and say "for you"
she seemed happy for a moment but then it changed to a face of worry. She picked up a little corked bottle with some sort of bones in them, but i waved it off saying " its okay, You don't have too" she put it down and picked up a tiny painted canvas with the moon over a sea. I could tell she was insistent so i just nod and say okay.
She gets up to hand it to me and cups it in my hand, holding it for a second as she nods back. But she doesn't let go. she places her other hand on me and pulls me into the store and all of a sudden I'm back at my house, sitting in front of my t.v.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>(conti)
The room is dark and the t.v is on a black screen with a slight buzzing sound. I can see my nephew and his father sitting down in front of me. I feel a bit of sadness as i remember having movie nights with my nephew when he was younger, but is much to old now to make time for his uncle. His father turns to me and says
"Is this what you wanted?"
I see the t.v flicker and a warning text comes up, i don't think much about it until he says " should he watch?"
A terrible feeling washes over me as i shoot up from the couch enough to cover my nephews eyes and ears the best i can with my hands.
Some black and white shapes flash on the screen with electrical fuzz in the background, eventually a horrifying set of eyes flashes on screen and i can feel my nephew crying behind my hands. His father is gone now and i can only focus on the t.v
I remind my self. "I've been through this, it will pass" I repeat this several times "I've been through this, I've been through this, I've been through this, Mammons sight"
all of a sudden That phrase just keeps repeating in my mind
Mammons sight
Mammons sight
Mammons sight
then an image starts to form behind the eyes of the screen.
And i wake up remembering those words.
I'm sweating, heart is racing, and i know i went through another episode. But i can't get it out of my head.
it's hard to remember what it looked like exactly but ill try to draw it.
this has definitely been the oddest instance of paranoia I've had, and i really didn't know where to talk about this besides here.
sorry for the long post, hopefully i didn't break any rules

The problem is, most of us forgot how to dream real dreams, and when we start to remember; someone will typically insist on projecting an interpretation onto it from some self assumed position of authority on dreams and their meanings.

The best thing you can do is to start a disciplined sleep schedule and nightly ritual, one that you can program as habit into your nightly routine. Trying to meditate on wanting to explore your dreams, or your more important thoughts can help. Trying to hard will push it away. And dream journals can be a bit risky. Just practice at it like you will start to practice at replacing your habit of leaning on alcohol as an out, or a way to self medicate(poison)

We've been through this before, relax.
Deep breaths, in through the nose, and slowly out the mouth(half speed of inhale)

Mindful breathing, and sleep meditation is big medicine.

posts.sub: Do Humans Have An Immortal Soul?
posts.com:
Do humans have an immortal soul?
What about beasts and birds?
Fish?
Insects?
At times I have meditated only for a better sense of mindfulness and wellbeing and stumbled upon a discover that the “self” is separate from the mind and body.
This separate self may be a small attunement to the “Ohm” or the Brahman that Hindus, Buddhists and Taoists describe as a “oneness” with the universe and the ways of life around us. However, it feels smaller than that.
I am curious about astral projection and astral travel and while I have not attempted these feats myself, you do not have to search to hard to find accounts of an astral self which more than a few people seem very confident they have discovered.
I am not a Christian (nor am I a Buddhist), but I believe there is a lot of profound truth to be found in the Bible. Of course, in Abrahamic faiths, the concept of an immortal soul distinct from our physical selves is very prominent, as it is in countless other, more local sets of beliefs found across the globe and throughout history.
My question is this: do you believe that humans have an immortal soul?
Why or why not?
If so, what do you believe happens to the soul when we die, and why?
If not, what do you believe happens to the self when we die, and why?
I am conflicted, but am leaning to a “yes” on the first question, for the reasons I have provided. But I cannot tell how far it goes. I cannot say if every living thing has a soul, or if humans are for some reason unique in this. I cannot tell if every living thing, or at least every human, possesses its own soul, or if we all share one collective “soul” with myriad faces.
There was a time when I would have preached the latter theory with total confidence. At that time, I also believed, with absolute confidence, in reincarnation. Recently, I am not so sure. Recently, death has begun to frighten me again.

Some claim to use fear like a tool. Impressing it upon billions of living beings when and how they see fit.
And in the end, the fear of death looms near to all who must know it.

Those who would wish to "harness" fear as a means toward their own ends; are the very same who fear nothing more than their own eventual death.

And what of those rare souls who are the very embodiment of a deeper terror. A being shaped by anguish, whom nothing but dread follows.

And incarnation of terror? The manifestation of fear?
The one who always haunts your masters, taking the shape of their very shadows.

Who said fear is a bad thing? Why do so many associate it with evil, and the despair of innocence?

Fear itself only wishes to be near and dear to some accepting soul, I'm sure. Alone at the end, for even death, and the gods fear their own end. The void.


Let us teach each other new magic to help us become familiar with our fears, even to face them perhaps?

Or do they fear magic enough to bury it from the nexus, still?

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33807870
I really appreciate Beksinski's work. He was an "outsider artist" with no formal training. Outsider artists are fascinating to me. I have a feeling if he received formal instruction in painting they would have hampered his creativity to make him a "proper" artist. The man himself said something like "My style is the result of the deficiencies of my psyche." Also he didn't need to make any money off of his art either, he had a day job as an architect (which lends a lot towards his buildings and perspective IMO). Basically he was able to capitalize on his own vision for everything he made, that's why he's so distinctive.

I had the thought the other day that it was a shame he died relatively early in life (Polish problems). I wonder how his style would have evolved had he lived through the 2000s.

posts.com:
We gather in these generals to discuss our experiences, memories, and connection with Mother Lilith, as well as give other anons who are interested or would like to learn more about Her information or advice.

>Practices or rituals associated with Lilith?
This differs from person to person, but common approaches include giving energy to one of her sigils, chanting her enn, working with sexual spirits, doing what you think she would do, making offerings of incense/chocolate/tea, or simply praying.
While some people might feel the most comfortable engaging with her in a worshipful manner, blind faith is discouraged. It's always important to think and make decisions for oneself, and as such, Lilith guides us to understand things for ourselves.

>Books
- Liber Lilith by Donald Tyberson: https://www.pdfdrive.com/liber-lilith-a-gnostic-grimoire-e185231845.html
A Gnostic Grimoire and Novel. Beware that this book is rather dark, and some have mentioned attracting unwanted attention by reading it.
- Embracing Lilith by Mark H Williams: No PDF available online, but it's worth the price of admission.
Split into three sections, it covers accounts of working with the Goddess and her place in history, a fictional account of her origins written from her perspective, and a Grimoire.
- Lilith: Dark Feminine Archetype by Asenath Mason: https://pdfcoffee.com/lilith-dark-feminine-archetype-2-pdf-free.html
This one is a collection of writings by various peoples, with a brief but fairly thorough history at the beginning. There's a lot of random poetry in there; not useful for an occultist, but decent for an admirer.
- Lilith: Goddess of Sitra Ahra: https://zeitenundformen.files.wordpress.com/2014/01/lilith-goddess-of-sitra-ahrab-t-p.pdf
Contains a ton of aspects with associated variety of sigils.

The shroud does not show the image of Jmmanuel (alias Jesus Christ), but that of a merchant from Turin/Italy, called Caesar Canova.
The shroud was made by the brother of the deceased, Luciano Canova, an alchemist.

The process took place on 7 June 1324 and lasted until 10 June, i.e. 4 days.
During this, the procedure was not such that the shroud was placed on the deceased and the latter was rubbed with chemicals, as is often claimed, but it was a very early form of photography, whereby the corpse was placed vertically in front of a large glass lens, through which the image was then projected for four days through an effect of sunlight onto a large fabric surface soaked in chemicals in a dark room, after which the shroud was then treated with silver nitrate and the image became in that way visible and retained.

The earthly scientists will solve many other old mysteries and lift secrets.

For many years i suffered from weekslong episodes of chronic nightmares to the point where in the childhood and adult life i've faced times where i feared sleep. Sometimes you'll have a dream that is so wrong and unnerving and terrifying that you wonder where the shit comes from.

You have the "brain recycling information from the day" notion that hopeless rationalists will stick to, but what part of my day did i see hear about or think about a dozen mangled fetuses scattered among naked trees, or secret passage ways in my house to an alternate family?

I worked in Maine as a blueberry picker and general farmhand, and would sleep in a cabin in a wooded clearing. I would have dreams about the witch sometimes, and being eternally stalked. here is the main one i remember from this time, the chronology might be jumbled because i haven't thought about it for some time, ive actually been sleeping well for the past few months.

>wake up
>the type of frozen in terror wake up
>the kind thats like when youre really little, and youre sure the thing in the dark is watching but you dont know what to do about it so just push yourself into bed under the blanket as tight as you can type of feeling
>there are extra windows and doors in the cabin now
>they're all open
>this is unnerving because i always close all the windows and everything to get to sleep
>even the thought of my lamp being visible through all the cracks in between the lumber in the walls was bad enough at night

from that point i remember things starting to happen, like i knew she was coming, doors starting creaking or whatever, but ultimately it led to every door and window being slammed over and over deafening me

>yell to stop with "enough of this" shit tone

>i book it across the field and through the bracken to bosses house to try and find another human being in all the chaos

I had an extremely vivid dream which I can still recall in photographic detail years later. It goes like this:

I dreamed that I went into the engineering lab at work and one of my coworkers asked if I wanted to go visit the underground lab (IRL I was working at a big government lab at the time). I asked what it was, he told me it was a massive underground research facility, and he could get me clearance. I was interested and said "Yes."

There was a 3-4 week time skip of me getting clearance and sailing out across the ocean to an oil rig or something like it. I and the group I am with enter it, and take an elevator underneath the ocean, descending miles down into the Earth's crust. We step out into a massive, stone dome (at least a mile in diameter), illuminated with hazy artificial lighting simulating the setting sun. It even had cloud systems and you could hardly see the cave's walls through the artificial sky.

We were standing at the foot of a massive, opalescent white arcology in the middle of the dome. It reached all the way into the artificial clouds and I couldn't see its top. We went on in, and were taken into a guest hosting area.

After a time skip involving mundane living activities, one of my group, a pregnant woman, goes missing. I and a few others go looking for her, but after we can't find her in the areas we were told we could go, we went into the back areas, deeper into the arcology. She finds us more than we find her, running up to us with this manic look in her eyes. She excitedly clamoring about how the scientists had done this 'wonderful operation' on her. She was no longer pregnant, and we eventually figured out that the 'operation' was to remove the baby to do who knows what with. The entire time, she was manic, insisting it was a good thing, asking us to come have an operation too. She eventually runs off, and we find her dead a few minutes later, seemingly spontaneously died.

1/?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33822070
I then wondered off deeper into the archology, and the then "veneer" of human construction I had become familiar with in the 'guest areas' gave way to almost alien metal hallways. I eventually navigated through this to an interior cavity inside the arcology, emerging into a bombed out building. The arcology was large enough to house an entire city inside the cavity, and looking out from the bombed out windows, I could see buildings made from the strange white stone as the arcology. Everything suddenly reverted back to its prime, and I saw the city in its 'lived in' state, but over the course of a few seconds, I watched it decay into the ruins that it was now. I suddenly became very sad and was moved to tears, thinking over and over "How many millions died here" knowing a great disaster had happened here. I didn't know what the disaster was, but I somehow knew it was something that had been unleashed.

After a few moments, I became increadibly fearful, because I knew that the thing which had killed everyone here was still alive, and it had just spotted me. I had just enough time to look to my left and spot it before I was snatched up in a haze of blue light and ripped out of the dream. Everything went away except the 'thing'. It was a living entity, made out of what appeared to be organic stone. It was pyramid shaped, but missing the "keystone". In place of the keystone was a single, flaming eye from which the restraining blue light beamed out onto me. Orbiting it were concentric rings of flaming eyes, all staring at me and through me.

2/?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33822082
I remember saying "Lord protect me." It was at this point, I woke up for real and opened my eyes. For a few brief moments, my room was bathed in pale blue light. I don't know if it was my phone or something else, but I had this horrifying sensation that something followed me back from the dream. My eyes closed again and the dream continued.

I suddenly dropped down a few inches, landing on my feet in the middle of an unimaginably massive cathedral. It suddenly felt warm and extremely safe, and I looked around, taking in the stone columns as large as skyscrapers which supported a vaulted ceiling thousands of feet over my head. I was then whisked away to a room which felt 'scientific' - sterile white walls made of a single, seamless material, some technical looking equipment. Someone was in there, he was behind me, and he asked me to step up onto a dias in the middle of the room. I did, and he commented "You shouldn't have gone in there." at a the same time I disassociated and watched myself get telekinetically lifted up on the dias. Three etherial forms of myself slid out and moved onto adjacent diases. They looked like me, except for one which had been horrifically mutilated. The person there commented, "You nearly got yourself killed."

He started some kind of restorative process for the other body, and we talked for a while. I asked him questions about where I had been, what had happened, and he answered freely - I was never allowed to look at him though. All I remember is him saying "You have multiple bodies. One of them, your dream body, was destroyed. If you had stayed any longer, the rest of them would have been killed as well." At the end, he said something like, "I am sorry, but I can't let you remember most of this."

3/?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33822095
I then woke up again, rolled over to make sure I was awake, but was still stuck with the feeling that something had followed me back from the dream. I began digging into the feeling, and I suddenly realized I had an entire set of someone else's memories. I rolled onto my back and moved around a bit, just to make sure I was actually awake, and begun digging into the memories.

The place I had been was not human made. It had been created ages ago by the last sentient species that had lived on Earth. They had become very advanced, but had descended into 'dark technology' attempting to control spiritual forces with technology. They had also begun worshiping evil things. The city was a research city where they ran large scale experements, and some time ago, they had unleashed something which had killed their entire species. Humanity had discovered them long ago, but the governments had kept info about them under wraps. We had found that city back in the 40's or 50's and had moved in to repurpose it for our research. Recently, we had discovered their final project, and for some reason had started to try activating it again.

The memories belonged to an archilologist who had been sent there to study the city but who had ended up dying to the thing which I had encountered. I did some mental digging and came up with a name which I can't remember now, but I remember it feeling warm and familiar for some reason.

4/?

I then was overwhelmed by the feeling that something had followed me back, and saw a flash of a monstrous looking person with goat legs in the distance. I slapped myself in the face to make sure I was awake, then decided I needed to sleep it off. Closing my eyes, I got another flash, this time, the thing was right in my face, eye to eye with me. I startled, spent a few minutes browsing my phone to 'reset', then rolled onto my side to try to fall asleep. About that time, my top side started feeling damp and cold. It was summer, my sheets were dry, and I couldn't figure out why. As I drifted back off to sleep, the feeling that something had followed me back persisted, and I started feeling like "these thoughts aren't my own". Suddenly, I had another flash of a dream.

I saw a maggot like creature with translucent, sickly colored skin. It had a leech like mouth with concentric rings of inwardly pointing teeth, two black pincers at its mouth, and to wispy tendrils ending in knots of fibrous, bleeding red strands like a starfish's stomach. The image then shifted. I was looking at myself in the third person, and the creature (about 3ft long) was laying atop my side (the side which felt cold and numb). The two wispy tendrils of were extended over me and sunk into my skull, and somehow I knew that this thing had latched onto me somehow in a dream and was feeding off my mind.

Finally, I had enough and got out of bed. Didn't try going back to sleep for hours, but thankfully that was the last of that dream sequence.

I once had a very vivid dream in which some russian mafia looking guy immobilized me and as he said
>come here, fattie
he rammed a power drill up my ass.
To this day I'm convinced it was some sort of psychic attack or something like that. It was extremely vivid, and I could sense an extreme sense of malice coming out of this person, not to mention how terrifying it could've been if I hadn't been able to wake up before he turned on the drill.

Nightmares usually take form using preexisting emotions as a building block. So if, for example, you feel afraid, you dream of something that represents that fear, and you feel the fright all throughout the dream.
In this case, I didn't feel anything. It was as if something had invaded my dream and wanted to MAKE me afraid.

Since I am IP banned from Reddit(more like Deddit), I figured I will post all the interesting 'coincidences' in her 'accidental'(cough cough) death seeing as in is in my top favorite mysterious deaths. The other being Erin Valenti's and Rey Rivera's cases. Here goes in no particular order:

>She was 21 years old. 3 was found around 3 weeks after she went missing, 7x3=21.

>The 1996 short story collection had a story eerily similar to the Elisa Lam case, titled Floating Water. The short story was adapted to the 2002 & 2005 films both called Dark Water. This story was published around 18 years before Elisa died.

>There are at least 15 other deaths at the Cecil Hotel(now known as Stay On Main) ranging from suicides, murders and unknown causes.

>She was not the last death at the hotel, about 4 months later a unidentified 28 year old man was found. It is suspected he committed suicide by jumping of the building.

>2 serial killers stayed at Cecil Hotel: Richard Ramirez and Jack Unterweger, and both committed their killing while booked there.

>The last place she was supposedly seen at was fittingly called The Last Bookstore.

> The Last Bookstore's domain has a postal code in it's registration: "V5G 4S2". When plugged into Google Map, it leads straight to Elisa's burial site in Forest Lawn Memorial Park in Canada.

>Elisa stated on the 4th floor of Cecil, 4 is regarded as number related to death in East Asian countries due to it sounding similar to their word for it.

>Elisa sends a tweet on January 13th about a Canadian company that is getting support from the Pentagon to create a clocking material in order to make soldiers invisible.

>Interestingly enough, when you used to zoom into Cecil on Google Maps, you would find a company registered there called The Invisible Light Agency.

>A few days after her body was found, an outbreak of tuberculosis in homeless in downtown L.A.

>The test to find suspected tuberculosis is called LAM-ELISA, The reverse of Elisa Lam.

posts.com:
You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

That was a while back when my lucid dreams included recursion and groundhog day loop counters. At 4 minutes per loop and a counter incrementing to 478, that totals out to 31 hours, 52 minutes for a 2 hour duration of sleep.

Woke up in a state of hypervigilance. Dying 477 in dreams due to failure definitely put me on edge. Most of them I was trying to save personnel or try to find the source of failure, but the timer would expire and I'd die in a flash of light. Eventually I realized I could only save myself. The rest of the iterations were squeezing out as many optimal moves like a speedrunner. Iteration 478 kept me very clear of the implosion.

I've heard of people living entire lifetimes in dreams, hasn't happened for me. It's always been a looping or recursive dream where I perfect the ideal plan of action.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33806643
>How do i know if it's lucid dreaming or not?
You recognize a "full blown lucid dream" by your mental clarity, not what you're able to do. In full lucid dreams you have the same kind of sharp thinking as in real life, able to fully self-reflect and process thoughts as in waking life. In what you call dreams ibetween it's more like you're a zombie with a vague notion that there are no consequences for your actions.

>>33807184
If you're religious, you might benefit from thinking lucid dreaming is some kind of magic phenomena, since it will make it feel more real. If you want to just DILD, do the boring basic shit like keeping a dream journal, reality checks, and MILD before bed.

posts.com: When I was a kid, 5yrs old, my grandma was stabbed to death outside of our apartment by her boyfriend. She was young though I don't remember her exact age. My mom had me at 20 and she had my mom at a super young age too. I saw the murder but didn't really understand what happened - it was dark outside and my grandma was taking out the trash when he ambushed her. She was in the hospital for I think 2 days or so before finally dying. My mom always tells me about how I pointed out a woman in a red dress in her room at the hospital so I know this isn't just a weird memory I made up to cope with her dying. We weren't allowed in the room, so we were looking through a window at her last moments. For a few years before we moved out of the apartment, I'd experience weird things like feeling something grab my shoulders or touching my hair. I was a sensitive kid physically, I'd cry at like everything, and I remember really getting the shit scared out of me and screaming for my parents because some entity grabbed me. Fast forward to my teenage years and adulthood, and not sure if this has anything to do with my experience as a child, but I'd regularly predict illness and death in the family. One moment I remember in particular was when I was around 15 years old and my aunt had cancer... I had a horrible feeling all day, knowing it happened, and came home to news about her death. She was not the only family member I have accurately guessed their death the day it happens. As an adult, I think about these things less so I don't really have any recent experiences like this. I am also very desensitized to death at this point in my life, perhaps that has a lot to do with these premonitions fading away, despite death occurring more regularly due to age. Every year in October around when my grandma died, I believe it was the 18th, or 19th - I dont remember and don't wanna ask my mom, crows like to hang out in her garden, but otherwise they never stop there for anything.

>>33815242
There are 3 parts to your mind
>Conscious mind (ego)
>Subconscious mind (a.k.a. the deep mind)
>Superconscious mind (your "higher self", the most Godly part of you that has "perfect" ideas)

Your conscious mind interacts with the physical world, and tries to guide you with logic and reasoning. This is a double-edged sword, because on the one hand, you can learn from mistakes, but you can also suffer if you dwell on mistakes. You end up with thoughts like "you can't do this", or "see? you're such a bad person because you did this" and so on because of past events.

To answer your question, desires are a result of the conscious mind reacting to the world. For example, you come across a person that bothers you, and so the conscious mind gets your mind thinking about how to deal with the situation. It might suggest to become more reclusive and avoid that person. Maybe it will steer you to hate that person and attack them so that they go away. It could even make you think that you want the person dead. At the heart of it all, your ego is correct in that you don't want to be around that person, but your duty is to reel in the ideas that it creates reactively.

To take it one step further, your superconscious mind, seeing things from the point of view of the spirit realm, does not consider the past. When you need (spiritual, higher) guidance for "big" problems, you want to tap into this part of your mind to get the solution, where all your doubts are ignored.

>>33818173
>Would you agree that the higher consciousness would need to be in agreement with the conscious desire being impressed on the subconscious
No, actually. Your conscious mind is put in relatively strong control for the purpose of keeping you alive. It can usually override any higher or lower impulses if it needs to. I say usually because addictions and manias are a thing.

I have heard about people using override techniques to talk to people's "higher selves" to negotiate what they want from that level of the person to enforce on the others but I suspect that requires people to accept the idea of "higher self knows better than me" which I do not subscribe to and my higher self would not agree with anyway.

My experience is the conscious mind is a filter for the subconscious. If you are able to allow a thought to pass through it is done, the subconscious treats it as "approved/safe" when it comes through regardless of whether it really is or not.

Hey anon. Wow, that's a lot. I say you have 2 options, which aren't any crazy incantations, chants, rituals, spells, Ouija boards, etc.

1. Meditate. Meditate, and become the watcher. The watcher is your (our) spirit. You watch your mind from a distance. When you feel scared, know that you are watching your mind feel scared from a safe distance. Don't overthink meditation either- Sit up, attentive and powerful, and don't think about anything. Hear the silence or whatever small noises around you. When you catch your mind drifting off and thinking about something, catch it, observe the thought, and then let it go like a butterfly. And then continue to be a watcher.
